entry.title: Cooperation, Competition and Coercion

summary.p: When we look at the major societal choices facing us today, the primary question is not whether we want a society that is more cooperative or more competitive, but whether we're ready for a society that is less coercive.

entry.content: When we look at the major societal choices facing us today, the primary question is not whether we want a society that is more cooperative or more competitive, but whether we're ready for a society that is less coercive.

entry.title: Notenik 4.2.0 Released

summary.p: Some bug fixes, and some new functionality. If you have a Mac, then check it out!

entry.content: Some bug fixes, and some new functionality. If you have a Mac, then check it out!

entry.title: RS 500 Blog - 400 - 375

summary.p: Published the next batch of 25 albums to the RS 500 blog. Some notable albums in the 375 - 400 range, and some interesting comments from Charlie, Brian and myself. As always, three very different perspectives based on ages and interests.

entry.content: Published the next batch of 25 albums to the RS 500 blog. Some notable albums in the 375 - 400 range, and some interesting comments from Charlie, Brian and myself. As always, three very different perspectives based on ages and interests.

entry.title: Can the US Become a Truly Egalitarian Society?

summary.p: As with many of us, I've been thinking deeply lately about the murders of George Floyd, Ahmaud Arbery, Breanna Taylor, and so many other people of color, and wondering how and why these atrocities continue to occur in my country, and what we can do to turn things around.

entry.content: As with many of us, I've been thinking deeply lately about the murders of George Floyd, Ahmaud Arbery, Breanna Taylor, and so many other people of color, and wondering how and why these atrocities continue to occur in my country, and what we can do to turn things around.

entry.title: Notenik 4.0.0 Released
entry.content: Added a new Counts window to check word count; several minor UI improvements.

entry.title: In-Depth Analysis of Jackson Browne's Late for the Sky Album

summary.p: Finally completed an in-depth analysis of Jackson Browne's album Late for the Sky, a project I had begun years ago. It's a lot to read, but the album is worth it.

entry.content: Finally completed an in-depth analysis of Jackson Browne's album Late for the Sky, a project I had begun years ago. It's a lot to read, but the album is worth it.

entry.title: Democracy

summary.p: Wrote up a Practical Utopian "basics" piece on the core value of Democracy, after reading How Democracies Die.

entry.content: Wrote up a Practical Utopian "basics" piece on the core value of Democracy, after reading How Democracies Die.

entry.title: 8 Big Lessons We Can Learn from the Pandemic

summary.p: Suffering through a pandemic is a terrible way to have to learn a lesson or two about the nature of humanity. But it's what we have, so we may as well make use of it.

entry.content:
Suffering through a pandemic is a terrible way to have to learn a lesson or two about the nature of humanity. But it's what we have, so we may as well make use of it.

Also cross-posted on Medium.

entry.title: Virtual Textbanking Party

summary.p: For the progressive movement in 2020, a TextBanking party has nothing to do with your bank balances, and everything to do with who will be running our government for the next four years.

entry.content:
For the progressive movement in 2020, a TextBanking party has nothing to do with your bank balances, and everything to do with who will be running our government for the next four years.

A blog post for Seattle Indivisible.

entry.title: Notenik 3.6.0 Released

summary.p: Users can now drag and drop a Note from one Collection to another in order to copy it to the second Collection; a Note sharing option to insert Markdown block quotes has been added; improved apostrophe handling when using the Notenik Markdown parser; and a new Bookmarks Board allowing users to select an available Collection to be opened.

entry.content: Users can now drag and drop a Note from one Collection to another in order to copy it to the second Collection; a Note sharing option to insert Markdown block quotes has been added; improved apostrophe handling when using the Notenik Markdown parser; and a new Bookmarks Board allowing users to select an available Collection to be opened.
